texto: and disposition Requests for Change and Requests for Variance. NOTE 1 Evaluation commonly includes analysis of rationale and need versus impact on the software and interoperating systems, considering risks and opportunities, quality, users, schedule, and cost. A decision is made on whether to implement or deny the change request. NOTE 2 Requests for Change and Requests for Variance are often under the formal control of a Configuration Control Board (CCB). 3) Track and manage approved changes to the baseline, Requests for Change and Requests for Variance. NOTE 1 This task involves prioritization, tracking, scheduling, and closing changes. Changes are then made through the Technical Processes.
